item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (267 points | 63 comments)
2. Generate impressive-looking terminal output, look busy when stakeholders walk by (18 points | 3 comments)
3. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (217 points | 76 comments)
4. Career Advice in 2025 (82 points | 8 comments)
5. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (54 points | 2 comments)
6. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (131 points | 3 comments)
7. Finding Signal in the Noise: Machine Learning and the Markets (Jane Street) (100 points | 65 comments)
8. Milk Kanban (319 points | 132 comments)
9. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (57 points | 37 comments)
10. Mandelbrot Set Explorer (39 points | 7 comments)
11. Hyperion (Tree) (11 points | 5 comments)
12. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (20 points | 6 comments)
13. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (63 points | 39 comments)
14. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (65 points | 32 comments)
15. They're Close to My Body: A Hagiography of Nine Inch Nails and Robin Finck (2020) (100 points | 53 comments)
16. Sunset Geometry (2016) (85 points | 10 comments)
17. Lemma for the Fundamental Theorem of Galois Theory (120 points | 29 comments)
18. Show HN: Aiopandas – Async .apply() and .map() for Pandas, Faster API/LLMs Calls (37 points | 7 comments)
19. AutoHete: An Automatic and Efficient Heterogeneous Training System for LLMs (31 points | discuss)
20. Parahelp (YC S24) Is Hiring Founding Engineers (SF) ( | hide)
21. Computers and Mice – Mister Rogers Neighborhood (99 points | 29 comments)
22. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (219 points | 148 comments)
23. What Bikini Atoll Looks Like Today (2017) (131 points | 61 comments)
24. D-Wave quantum annealers solve problems classical algorithms struggle with (4 points | discuss)
25. Arbitrary-Scale Super-Resolution with Neural Heat Fields (133 points | 46 comments)
26. So Long and Thanks for All the Words: A Toast to Douglas Adams (203 points | 74 comments)
27. A look at Firefox forks (511 points | 339 comments)
28. Briar: Peer to Peer Encrypted Messaging (413 points | 170 comments)
29. Transformers Without Normalization (246 points | 30 comments)
30. RubyLLM: A delightful Ruby way to work with AI (611 points | 163 comments)
